data.text: @NumbersMuncher Then why didn’t they lift said mask mandates last year when cases dropped?

@NumbersMuncher Come on, man. It could have been done much, much sooner but the administration wanted a slam dunk on the national stage and to do a victory lap on the ensuing media cycle the SOTU gets.
@NumbersMuncher Worth noting that with home testing people are less likely to report to the health dept that they're positive.
@NumbersMuncher Case counts were lower in June than they are now.  Why weren’t they dropped back then?
@NumbersMuncher The case counts were lower than this in October and they didn’t lift the mandates. 🤷🏻‍♀️

@NumbersMuncher “since the beginning”

Eh, It was a packaged deal since the beginning: masking, hygiene, and social distancing until a vaccine was available. I don’t this it was irrelevant as you think, especially it serving as a visual reminder.
@NumbersMuncher I'm curious why they didn't do it last year before Delta when cases were plummeting as well but it didn't get as high as Omicron or decrease as fast as O
@NumbersMuncher So in one month, right before the SOTU, masks suddenly go away and it’s all based on science. That’s BS and you know it.
